Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of bearded man wearing festival wreath headdress, possibly a representation of Priapus. Head only. Mould-made and solid with crude back. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric with grey core, abundant mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Three heads (Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA607; NA570; Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1896-1908-E.4721) and two body fragments (Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum E.P.67; Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1896-1908-E.4702) from similar Priapus figures are known from Naukratis. Similar Priapus head in Dresden dated to the late 2nd century BC (Fischer 1994, no.698). Late 3rd century BC parallel (Bayer Niemeier 1988, no.468-9). Also see 1st century BC parallel from Tell Atrib (Szymańska 2005, no. 7), but distinct from Roman variants (Bailey 2008, 3380; British Museum EA 1874,0314.6). Bayer Niemeier , E. 1988, Bildwerke der Sammlung Kaufmann / Liebieghaus Museum Alter Plastik Frankfurt am Main I. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten, Melsungen. Fischer, J. 1994, Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber, Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen, Tübinger Studien zur Archäologie und Kunstgeschichte 14, Tübingen. Szymańska, H. 2005, Terres cuites d’Athribis, Turnhout.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.248) (Phase 3)
